title: Discrete Applied Mathematics
summary: Discrete Applied Mathematics is a peer-reviewed scientific journal covering algorithmic and applied areas of discrete mathematics. It is published by Elsevier and the editor-in-chief is Endre Boros (Rutgers University). The journal was split off from another Elsevier journal, Discrete Mathematics, in 1979,[1] with that journal's founder Peter Ladislaw Hammer as its founding editor-in-chief.[2]
